definitions.definition: in accordance with the rules or standards; legitimate.
examples: the group has achieved fair and equal representation for all its members
synonyms: on the level; on the up and up "the courts were generally fair"

definitions.definition: just or appropriate in the circumstances.
examples: to be fair, this subject poses special problems

definitions.definition: (of a means or procedure) gentle; not violent.
(of a batted ball) within the field of play marked by the first and third baselines.
pertaining to the fair part of the field.
examples: the ball was hit into fair territory

definitions.definition: (of hair or complexion) light; blond.
examples: blond/blonde, yellowish, golden, flaxen, light, light brown, ash blond More"fair hair"pale, light, light-colored, white, creamy "Hermione's fair skin"Morefair hairpale, light, light-colored, white, creamy Hermione's fair skin

definitions.definition: (of a person) having a light complexion or blond hair.
considerable though not outstanding in size or amount.
examples: he did a fair bit of coaching

definitions.definition: moderately good though not outstandingly so.
examples: he believes he has a fair chance of success

definitions.definition: (of weather) fine and dry.
examples: fine, dry, bright, clear, sunny, cloudless; Morewarm, balmy, clement, benign, pleasant "fair weather"Morewarm, balmy, clement, benign, pleasant fair weather

definitions.definition: (of the wind) favorable.
examples: they set sail with a fair wind

definitions.definition: beautiful: attractive.
(of words, a speech, or a promise) false, despite being initially attractive or pleasing; specious.
without cheating or trying to achieve unjust advantage.
examples: no one could say he played fair

definitions.definition: to a high degree.
examples: she'll be fair delighted to see you

definitions.definition: a beautiful woman.
(of the weather) become fine.
examples: looks like it's fairing off some

definitions.definition: a gathering of stalls and amusements for public entertainment.
examples: carnival, festival, exhibition; midway a country fair

definitions.definition: a competitive exhibition of livestock, agricultural products, and household skills held annually by a town, county, or state and also featuring entertainment and educational displays.
examples: noun: agricultural fair; plural noun: agricultural fairs

definitions.definition: a periodic gathering for the sale of goods.
examples: market, bazaar, flea market, exchange, sale; emporium an antiques fair

definitions.definition: an exhibition to promote particular products.
streamline (a vehicle, boat, or aircraft) by adding fairings.
